content.question: Which of the following best describes a potential advantage of using geothermal energy instead of solar farms for power generation?

choices.label: Harnessing geothermal energy does not release hydrogen sulfide gas, whereas solar farms do.
Geothermal energy does not release greenhouse gases, whereas solar farms do.
Geothermal energy can be harnessed without destroying large tracts of habitat, whereas solar farms require large amounts of space.
Geothermal energy is easily accessible and can be harnessed in most parts of the world, whereas solar energy is difficult to harness.

content.answer: Geothermal energy can be harnessed without destroying large tracts of habitat, whereas solar farms require large amounts of space.
